info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 19 at 7:28PM CDT until March 20 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County.
For the Duck River...including Centerville...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Duck River at Centerville.
* WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the banks. At 22.0 feet, Flood waters will cover the flood plain along the river. Several roads near the river will be partially covered. In Centerville, Hickman Springs Road and Defeated Creek Road will be affected. Leatherwood Road between Shady Grove and Primm Springs near Tottys Bend will also be affected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.4 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to drop through the overnight hours and drop below action stage Thursday morning. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WARNING
